children.subject:
Definitely take the time to explore research areas and projects professors are working on that interest you. Some resources for this include https://www2.eecs.berkeley.edu/Research/Areas/?_ga=2.66560621.2142097506.1556163706-362785657.1547419926. Also consider looking at undergrad job listings at http://beehive.berkeley.edu/.

As far as emailing professors, definitely do that but understand that professors are busy and may not always have the time to get back to you. In my personal experience I have found that it is beneficial to email graduate students as they are often more likely to respond. Also, graduate students are generally looking for undergrads to bring aboard their project. Ask any graduate TAs you have had or even undergrad TAs that have done research, as they can put you in contact with other graduate students and/or professors that are willing to hire undergrads.
Look into the Data Science Discovery Research program! I think they're still taking applications

history.content: Not feeling too hopeful about getting an internship at this point since it's pretty late :(. Is it hard for students to get research in data science/cs labs over the summer here at berkeley if I were to try and email professors now? Does anyone have any experience with this?
history.subject: Research over summer
